titleStmt.title: W. Brown et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9561

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excelency the Honl. Beriah Magoffin Govenor of Kentucky

Whereas Petitions have been circulated in the Counties of Caldwell Lyon, Trigg, Christian & Hopkins beseeching of your excellency to pardon or commute the punishment of Thos B Wadlington convicted at the last November term of the Caldwell Circuit Court of the murder of Milton, A, Cartwright, We the undersigned citizens of Caldwell County believing the verdict of the Jury in the Case of said Wadlington to be correct and that he deserves the penalty due to crime from our knowledge of the facts most earnestly beseech of your excellency not to pardon or commute the punishment of said Wadlington and hereby enter our solemn protest against granting the prayer of said petition
